input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system smoke detector, providing early detection and alerts in case of smoke or fire.
output: Scrum User Story: Smoke Detector Integration Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system smoke detector, providing early detection and alerts in case of smoke or fire. This will enhance safety by detecting and alerting to potential fire hazards. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should support the integration of smoke detectors. Customers should be able to install and configure smoke detectors in key areas. The system should provide immediate alerts and notifications upon detecting smoke or fire. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Install Smoke Detector Given that I am a customer When I want to integrate a smoke detector with the security system And I access the smoke detector settings Then I should be able to install and configure the smoke detector Scenario: Smoke Detection Alerts Given that I am a customer with smoke detectors integrated When the smoke detector detects smoke or fire Then I should immediately receive alerts and notifications to respond to the potential fire hazard Scenario: Smoke Detector Battery Monitoring Given that I am a customer with smoke detectors integrated When the smoke detector's battery is low or needs replacement Then I should receive notifications to replace the battery for continued functionality

This will enhance safety by detecting and alerting to potential fire hazards. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should support the integration of smoke detectors. Customers should be able to install and configure smoke detectors in key areas. The system should provide immediate alerts and notifications upon detecting smoke or fire. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Install Smoke Detector Given that I am a customer When I want to integrate a smoke detector with the security system And I access the smoke detector settings Then I should be able to install and configure the smoke detector Scenario: Smoke Detection Alerts Given that I am a customer with smoke detectors integrated When the smoke detector detects smoke or fire Then I should immediately receive alerts and notifications to respond to the potential fire hazard Scenario: Smoke Detector Battery Monitoring Given that I am a customer with smoke detectors integrated When the smoke detector's battery is low or needs replacement Then I should receive notifications to replace the battery for continued functionality</s>

input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system pet-friendly motion sensor, allowing me to secure my home without triggering false alarms due to pets.
output: Scrum User Story: Pet-Friendly Motion Sensor Integration Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system pet-friendly motion sensor, allowing me to secure my home without triggering false alarms due to pets. This will enhance security while accommodating the presence of pets. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should support the integration of pet-friendly motion sensors. Customers should be able to install and configure pet-friendly motion sensors in areas with pets. The motion sensor should distinguish between human intruders and pets, reducing false alarms. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Install Pet-Friendly Motion Sensor Given that I am a customer When I want to integrate a pet-friendly motion sensor with the security system And I access the motion sensor settings Then I should be able to install and configure the pet-friendly motion sensor Scenario: Pet-Friendly Motion Detection Given that I am a customer with pet-friendly motion sensors integrated When the motion sensor detects movement And the movement is caused by a pet Then the system should not trigger an intrusion alarm Scenario: Human Intruder Detection Given that I am a customer with pet-friendly motion sensors integrated When the motion sensor detects movement And the movement is caused by a human intruder Then the system should trigger an intrusion alarm

input: As a customer, I want to receive real-time notifications on my smartphone when a security event occurs in my home.
output: Scrum User Story: Real-time Notifications Description: As a customer, I want to receive real-time notifications on my smartphone when a security event occurs in my home. input: As a security technician, I want a user-friendly dashboard to monitor the status of all connected security devices in a customer's home.
output: Scrum User Story: User-friendly Dashboard for Technicians Description: As a security technician, I want a user-friendly dashboard to monitor the status of all connected security devices in a customer's home. input: As a customer, I want the option to arm and disarm my security system remotely using a mobile app.
output: Scrum User Story: Remote Arm/Disarm via Mobile App Description: As a customer, I want the option to arm and disarm my security system remotely using a mobile app. This will provide me with convenient control over my security system even when I'm away from home. input: As a customer, I want to have the option to receive video clips or images from my security cameras when specific events are triggered, such as motion detection or doorbell rings.

input: As a customer, I want to receive automatic software updates for my security system to ensure it stays up-to-date and secure.

input: As a new customer, I want to register my account and security devices easily through the mobile app.

input: As a customer, I want the ability to easily unregister and remove security devices from my account.
output: Scrum User Story: Device Unregistration for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the ability to easily unregister and remove security devices from my account. input: As a user, I want the option to easily transfer my alarm devices to a new location or residence.
output: Scrum User Story: Alarm Device Transfer to New Location Description: As a user, I want the option to easily transfer my alarm devices to a new location or residence. input: As a data center technician, I want to receive real-time alerts for critical system events and failures to ensure rapid response and minimize downtime.
output: Scrum User Story: Real-time Alerts for Critical System Events Description: As a data center technician, I want to receive real-time alerts for critical system events and failures to ensure rapid response and minimize downtime. This will help in proactively addressing issues and maintaining high availability. Criteria of acceptance: The monitoring system should generate real-time alerts for critical system events. Technicians should receive alerts through multiple channels (email, SMS, dashboard). Alerts should include detailed information about the event and its impact. output: Scrum User Story: Power Usage Monitoring and Alerts Description: As a data center manager, I want to monitor power usage and receive alerts when power consumption approaches critical levels to prevent outages. input: As a data center technician, I want the ability to perform remote diagnostics and troubleshooting for signal-related issues to reduce on-site visits.
output: Scrum User Story: Remote Diagnostics for Signal Issues Description: As a data center technician, I want the ability to perform remote diagnostics and troubleshooting for signal-related issues to reduce on-site visits. This will help in resolving problems efficiently and minimizing downtime. Criteria of acceptance: The monitoring system should provide remote diagnostic tools for signal issues. Technicians should be able to access signal data and perform diagnostics remotely. Remote troubleshooting should include solutions or recommendations. input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage security system user profiles, allowing me to grant limited access to other individuals.
output: Scrum User Story: User Profiles for Limited Access Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage security system user profiles, allowing me to grant limited access to other individuals. input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system geofencing feature, allowing the system to automatically arm or disarm based on my location.
output: Scrum User Story: Geofencing Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system geofencing feature, allowing the system to automatically arm or disarm based on my location. This will enhance convenience and ensure that the security system is active when I leave home and disarmed when I return. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should support geofencing. Customers should be able to define geofence boundaries. The system should automatically arm when the customer leaves the geofence and disarm when they enter it. input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system backup power source, ensuring that the system remains operational during power outages.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Power Source Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up and manage a security system backup power source, ensuring that the system remains operational during power outages. This will provide continuous security coverage even when the main power supply is disrupted. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should support a backup power source configuration. input: As a customer, I want to receive email notifications in addition to mobile notifications for security alerts and system status updates.

input: As a user, I want to receive monthly reports summarizing security incidents and system activity.
output: Scrum User Story: Monthly Security Reports for Users Description: As a user, I want to receive monthly reports summarizing security incidents and system activity. This will provide a comprehensive overview of the security status over time. Criteria of acceptance: The system should automatically generate and send monthly reports to users. input: As a business owner, I want to set up different security profiles for different areas of my premises.
output: Scrum User Story: Custom Security Profiles for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want to set up different security profiles for different areas of my premises. This will allow me to tailor the security system to the specific needs of various zones within my business. Criteria of acceptance: The system should allow business owners to create and customize security profiles. Profiles should include settings for alarm sensitivity, camera monitoring, and access control. Business owners should be able to assign profiles to different areas of their premises. input: As a homeowner, I want the option to remotely control and monitor my smart doorbell through the mobile app.
output: Scrum User Story: Remote Control for Smart Doorbell Description: As a homeowner, I want the option to remotely control and monitor my smart doorbell through the mobile app. This will enhance my home security and provide convenience when managing visitors. Criteria of acceptance: The mobile app should allow homeowners to remotely control the smart doorbell, including viewing the camera feed and talking to visitors. Homeowners should receive notifications when the doorbell is pressed or motion is detected. The app should store recorded footage of doorbell activity for later review. input: As a user, I want to have the option to share live camera feeds with trusted contacts during emergencies.

input: As a homeowner, I want the ability to set up geofencing to automatically arm and disarm my security system.

Reports should include a log of employee entry and exit times, along with any access control events. Business owners should be able to export reports in various formats (e.g., CSV, PDF). input: As a homeowner, I want the ability to receive security breach alerts even when the system is disarmed.
output: Scrum User Story: Disarmed Security Breach Alerts for Homeowners Description: As a homeowner, I want the ability to receive security breach alerts even when the security system is disarmed. This will ensure that I am immediately notified of any unauthorized access or security breaches, regardless of the system's status. Criteria of acceptance: The system should send security breach alerts to homeowners when unauthorized access or breaches occur, even if the security system is disarmed. Alerts should include relevant information about the breach, such as the location and type of breach. Homeowners should have the option to customize breach alert preferences. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Receive Security Breach Alert Given that I am a homeowner with the security system disarmed When a security breach occurs, such as a door or window opening Then I should receive an immediate security breach alert with details Scenario: Customize Breach Alert Preferences Given that I am a homeowner When I access the notification settings And I want to customize my security breach alert preferences Then I should be able to specify the types of breaches that trigger alerts

This will ensure that I am immediately notified of any unauthorized access or security breaches, regardless of the system's status. Criteria of acceptance: The system should send security breach alerts to homeowners when unauthorized access or breaches occur, even if the security system is disarmed. input: As a customer, I want the option to integrate my security system with third-party home automation platforms.
output: Scrum User Story: Integration with Home Automation for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the option to integrate my security system with third-party home automation platforms. This will allow me to create a seamless smart home experience by controlling security alongside other connected devices. Criteria of acceptance: The system should offer integration with popular third-party home automation platforms, such as SmartThings or Apple HomeKit. input: As a parent, I want to receive notifications when my child's security access code is used.
output: Scrum User Story: Child Access Notifications for Parents Description: As a parent, I want to receive notifications when my child's security access code is used. This will allow me to keep track of when my child enters or exits the premises, enhancing their safety and my peace of mind. input: As a business owner, I want the option to create and manage access control cards for employees.
output: Scrum User Story: Access Control Cards for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want the option to create and manage access control cards for employees. This will streamline the process of granting and revoking access to our premises and ensure the security of our business. Criteria of acceptance: The system should provide business owners with the ability to create access control cards for employees. Business owners should be able to specify the access privileges and validity periods for each card. Access control cards should be easy to manage and deactivate when necessary. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Create Access Control Card Given that I am a business owner When I access the access control card management feature And I want to create a new access control card for an employee Then I should be able to specify the employee's details, access privileges, and card validity period Scenario: Deactivate Access Control Card Given that I am a business owner with created access control cards When I need to deactivate an employee's access Then I should be able to easily deactivate the access control card

input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security.
output: Scrum User Story: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up multi-factor authentication (MFA) for added security. This will enhance the protection of my account and ensure that only authorized users can access it. Criteria of acceptance: The system should offer customers the option to enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for their accounts. Customers should be able to choose from various MFA methods, such as SMS codes, authenticator apps, or biometrics. MFA setup and usage should be straightforward and well-documented. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication Given that I am a customer When I access the account security settings And I want to enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) Then I should be able to choose my preferred MFA method and complete the setup Scenario: Use Multi-Factor Authentication Given that I am a customer with MFA enabled When I log in to my account Then I should be prompted to complete the MFA verification before accessing my account

input: As a business owner, I want to receive after-hours access requests from employees for added security.
output: Scrum User Story: After-Hours Access Requests for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want to receive after-hours access requests from employees for added security. This will provide additional visibility and enhance the security of my premises. Criteria of acceptance: The system should allow homeowners to connect and set up security cameras. Homeowners should be able to view live video feeds from their cameras through the security app. Camera installation and setup should be user-friendly and well-documented. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Set Up Security Camera Given that I am a homeowner When I access the security camera settings And I want to set up a security camera for monitoring Then I should be able to connect and configure the camera Scenario: View Live Camera Feeds Given that I am a homeowner with installed security cameras When I want to view live video feeds from the cameras Then I should be able to access the camera feeds through the security app

input: As a business owner, I want the ability to receive detailed reports on access logs and entry/exit times for my employees.
output: Scrum User Story: Access Reports for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want the ability to receive detailed reports on access logs and entry/exit times for my employees. This will help me track employee attendance and ensure that the premises are secure. Criteria of acceptance: The system should provide business owners with access to access logs and entry/exit time reports. Reports should include information about employee access, entry times, and exit times. Business owners should be able to specify date ranges for the reports. input: As a customer, I want the option to integrate my security system with environmental sensors for monitoring factors like smoke and carbon monoxide.
output: Scrum User Story: Environmental Sensor Integration for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the option to integrate my security system with environmental sensors for monitoring factors like smoke and carbon monoxide. This will provide comprehensive protection for my property. Criteria of acceptance: The system should allow customers to integrate their security system with compatible environmental sensors. Environmental sensors should detect factors like smoke, carbon monoxide, and temperature changes. Customers should receive notifications and alerts when environmental sensor thresholds are exceeded. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Integrate Environmental Sensors Given that I am a customer When I access the environmental sensor integration settings And I want to integrate my security system with environmental sensors Then I should be able to link the sensors to the security platform Scenario: Receive Environmental Alerts Given that I am a customer with integrated environmental sensors When environmental factors such as smoke or carbon monoxide are detected Then I should receive immediate notifications and alerts regarding the detected issue

input: As a homeowner, I want the option to set up a backup power source for my security system in case of power outages.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Power Source for Homeowners Description: As a homeowner, I want the option to set up a backup power source for my security system in case of power outages. This will ensure that my security system remains operational even when there is no electricity. Criteria of acceptance: The system should allow homeowners to set up and configure backup power sources. Backup power sources should automatically activate when a power outage occurs. Homeowners should receive notifications when the security system switches to backup power. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Configure Backup Power Source Given that I am a homeowner When I access the backup power source settings And I want to set up a backup power source for my security system Then I should be able to specify the type of backup power source and configure its settings Scenario: Activate Backup Power Given that I am a homeowner with a configured backup power source When a power outage occurs Then the security system should automatically switch to backup power And I should receive a notification indicating the switch to backup power

input: As a business owner, I want the ability to set up multiple security profiles with different settings for different times of day.
output: Scrum User Story: Multiple Security Profiles for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want the ability to set up multiple security profiles with different settings for different times of day. This will allow me to customize security measures based on business hours and after-hours security needs. output: Scrum User Story: Geolocation-Based Arming for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the option to set up geolocation-based arming and disarming of my security system. input: As a business owner, I want the ability to set up secure access control systems with card readers for employees.

input: As a customer, I want the ability to receive alerts when my security cameras detect motion.
output: Scrum User Story: Motion Detection Alerts for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the ability to receive alerts when my security cameras detect motion. This will help me stay informed about potential intruders or suspicious activity around my property. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should send alerts to customers when motion is detected by security cameras. Customers should be able to customize the motion detection alert preferences. Alerts should provide real-time information about the location and type of motion detected. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Configure Motion Detection Alerts Given that I am a customer When I access the security camera settings And I want to configure motion detection alerts Then I should be able to customize the alert preferences Scenario: Receive Motion Detection Alerts Given that I am a customer with configured motion detection alerts When the security cameras detect motion Then I should receive real-time alerts specifying the location and type of motion detected

input: As a customer, I want the ability to set up geofencing for my security system, so it automatically arms when I leave the property and disarms when I return.
output: Scrum User Story: Geofencing for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the ability to set up geofencing for my security system, so it automatically arms when I leave the property and disarms when I return. This will enhance the convenience and security of my system. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should allow customers to configure geofencing settings. Customers should be able to define the geofence boundaries and triggers. Geofencing should automatically arm the system when the customer leaves the defined area and disarm it upon return. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Configure Geofencing Given that I am a customer When I access the security system settings And I want to configure geofencing Then I should be able to define the geofence boundaries and triggers Scenario: Geofencing Automation Given that I am a customer with configured geofencing When I leave the defined geofence area Then the security system should automatically arm itself Scenario: Disarm with Geofencing Given that I am a customer with configured geofencing When I return to the defined geofence area Then the security system should automatically disarm itself

This will enhance the convenience and security of my system. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should allow customers to configure geofencing settings. Customers should be able to define the geofence boundaries and triggers. Geofencing should automatically arm the system when the customer leaves the defined area and disarm it upon return. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Configure Geofencing Given that I am a customer When I access the security system settings And I want to configure geofencing Then I should be able to define the geofence boundaries and triggers Scenario: Geofencing Automation Given that I am a customer with configured geofencing When I leave the defined geofence area Then the security system should automatically arm itself Scenario: Disarm with Geofencing Given that I am a customer with configured geofencing When I return to the defined geofence area Then the security system should automatically disarm itself</s>

input: As a business owner, I want the ability to set up user access levels and permissions for my security system.
output: Scrum User Story: User Access Control for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want the ability to set up user access levels and permissions for my security system. This will allow me to control who can access and manage the security system. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should provide business owners with user access control features. input: As a customer, I want to set up geofencing to automatically arm or disarm my security system when I leave or return home.
output: Scrum User Story: Geofencing for Customers Description: As a customer, I want to set up geofencing to automatically arm or disarm my security system when I leave or return home. This will provide convenience and enhance security. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should support geofencing functionality. input: As a customer, I want to receive alerts when unusual activity is detected, such as unexpected motion or door/window openings.
output: Scrum User Story: Alerts for Unusual Activity for Customers Description: As a customer, I want to receive alerts when unusual activity is detected, such as unexpected motion or door/window openings. This will help me respond quickly to potential security breaches. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should detect unusual activity, such as motion or door/window openings. Customers should receive immediate alerts when such activity is detected. Alerts should specify the type and location of the detected activity. input: As a business owner, I want to set up automated schedules for arming and disarming the security system based on business hours.
output: Scrum User Story: Automated Schedules for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want to set up automated schedules for arming and disarming the security system based on business hours. This will help ensure that the system is active during non-business hours and disarmed during operating hours. input: As a business owner, I want to have a backup power source for the security system to ensure it functions during power outages.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Power Source for Business Owners Description: As a business owner, I want to have a backup power source for the security system to ensure it functions during power outages. This will help maintain the security of my business premises. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should have a backup power source, such as a battery or generator. The backup power source should automatically activate during power outages. The system should continue to operate with the backup power source. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Ensure Backup Power Given that I am a business owner When the security system is connected to a backup power source Then the backup power source should be tested for functionality Scenario: Activate Backup Power Given that I am a business owner with a power outage When the main power source fails Then the security system should automatically activate the backup power source

input: As a homeowner, I want to set up security zones and customize the monitoring sensitivity for each zone.

input: As a vehicle owner, I want to receive immediate notifications on my smartphone when a car crash is detected by the Securitas Direct car security system, so that I can quickly request assistance or inform authorities if necessary.
output: Scrum User Story: Car Crash Notifications Description: As a vehicle owner, I want to receive immediate notifications on my smartphone when a car crash is detected by the Securitas Direct car security system, so that I can quickly request assistance or inform authorities if necessary. Acceptance Criteria: The car crash detection system should be integrated into the Securitas Direct mobile app. The app must be compatible with both iOS and Android operating systems. When a car crash occurs, the system should automatically detect it and notify the user. The notification should include the crash location, severity, and a button to request assistance. If the user doesn't respond to the notification within a certain time frame, emergency services should be alerted automatically. The user should have the option to dismiss the notification if it's a false alarm. The app should provide a history log of car crash events with details. Scenario: Automatic Car Crash Detection Given that I am a vehicle owner with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When a car crash occurs involving my vehicle Then I should receive an automatic notification on my smartphone And the notification should include crash details and a request for assistance. Scenario: User Response to Car Crash Notification Given that I am a vehicle owner with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I receive a car crash notification And I press the 'Request Assistance' button Then the app should notify emergency services and provide them with my location And I should receive confirmation of the request for assistance. Scenario: Dismissing a False Alarm Given that I am a vehicle owner with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I receive a car crash notification And I determine that it's a false alarm Then I should be able to dismiss the notification And no further action should be taken by the system.

input: As a user, I want the ability to customize the sensitivity of the car crash detection system to reduce false alarms and improve accuracy.
output: Scrum User Story: Customizable Crash Detection Sensitivity Description: As a user, I want the ability to customize the sensitivity of the car crash detection system to reduce false alarms and improve accuracy. Acceptance Criteria: The Securitas Direct mobile app should allow users to adjust the sensitivity of the car crash detection system. Users should be able to choose from multiple sensitivity levels, including low, medium, and high. Changes in sensitivity should reflect in the system's behavior and notification thresholds. The app should provide clear guidance on the implications of different sensitivity settings. Scenario: Adjusting Crash Detection Sensitivity Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I access the car crash detection settings And I choose a higher sensitivity level Then the system should be more responsive to minor crashes And I should receive notifications for a broader range of crash intensities. Scenario: Setting Sensitivity to Medium Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I access the car crash detection settings And I choose the medium sensitivity level Then the system should provide a balanced level of sensitivity And notifications should be triggered for moderate to severe crashes. Scenario: Lowering Sensitivity Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I access the car crash detection settings And I choose a lower sensitivity level Then the system should be less responsive to minor events And notifications should be limited to more severe crashes.

input: As a user, I want the ability to add emergency contacts to my Securitas Direct profile, so that they can be notified in case of a car crash or other emergency.

output: Scrum User Story: Notifications During 'Do Not Disturb' Mode Description: As a user, I want the ability to receive car crash notifications even when my smartphone is in 'Do Not Disturb' mode, ensuring that I am alerted to emergencies. Acceptance Criteria: The Securitas Direct mobile app should have the capability to deliver car crash notifications regardless of the user's smartphone 'Do Not Disturb' mode settings. Notifications should be distinctive and override 'Do Not Disturb' mode to grab the user's attention during emergencies. The app should provide an option for users to enable or disable this feature. Scenario: Receiving Notifications in 'Do Not Disturb' Mode Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I enable the option to receive car crash notifications during 'Do Not Disturb' mode And my smartphone is in 'Do Not Disturb' mode Then I should still receive car crash notifications with a distinctive alert sound And the notification should override 'Do Not Disturb' mode settings. Scenario: Emergency Notification Override Explanation Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed And I enable the option to receive car crash notifications during 'Do Not Disturb' mode When I receive a notification during 'Do Not Disturb' mode Then the app should provide an explanation that this is an emergency notification and requires my immediate attention.

input: As a user, I want the car crash notification to include a direct link to make an emergency call to the local authorities or emergency services.
output: Scrum User Story: Direct Emergency Call from Notification Description: As a user, I want the car crash notification to include a direct link to make an emergency call to the local authorities or emergency services. Acceptance Criteria: When a car crash notification is received, it should include a prominently displayed button or link that, when pressed, initiates an emergency call to the appropriate local authorities or emergency services. The emergency call feature should be accessible even if the smartphone is locked. The user should be able to cancel the call if it was triggered accidentally. Scenario: Initiating Emergency Call from Notification Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When I receive a car crash notification And I press the 'Emergency Call' button or link in the notification Then the app should initiate an emergency call to the local authorities or emergency services. Scenario: Emergency Call Accessibility from Locked Smartphone Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed When my smartphone is locked And I receive a car crash notification with an 'Emergency Call' link Then I should be able to access and initiate the emergency call without unlocking my smartphone. Scenario: Canceling an Accidental Emergency Call Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed And I accidentally initiate an emergency call from a notification Then I should be able to cancel the emergency call before it connects And the app should confirm the cancellation.

input: As a user, I want the car crash notification to display a countdown timer indicating the time remaining to cancel the emergency call, allowing me to avoid accidental calls.
output: Scrum User Story: Countdown Timer for Emergency Call Cancellation Description: As a user, I want the car crash notification to display a countdown timer indicating the time remaining to cancel the emergency call, allowing me to avoid accidental calls. Acceptance Criteria: When a car crash notification is received, it should include a visible countdown timer that indicates the time remaining to cancel the initiated emergency call. The timer should be prominently displayed and easy to see. The user should have the option to cancel the call at any point before the timer expires. Scenario: Emergency Call Proceeds When Timer Expires Given that I am a user with the Securitas Direct mobile app installed And I have initiated an emergency call from a notification with a countdown timer When the timer expires without cancellation Then the app should proceed with the emergency call to the local authorities or emergency services.

output: Scrum User Story: History of Car Crash Notifications Description: As a user, I want to be able to review the history of car crash notifications and emergency calls within the Securitas Direct mobile app for reference and reporting. input: As a customer, I want to have a mobile app that provides a user-friendly interface for managing my security system.
output: Scrum User Story: User-Friendly Mobile App Description: As a customer, I want to have a mobile app that provides a user-friendly interface for managing my security system. This will make it easier for me to control and monitor my home security on the go. Criteria of acceptance: The mobile app should be available for both iOS and Android devices. The app should provide easy access to arming and disarming the security system. Customers should be able to view live camera feeds and receive real-time alerts. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Installing the Mobile App Given that I am a customer When I have a compatible smartphone And I download and install the Securitas Direct mobile app Then I should be able to launch the app Scenario: Arming and Disarming Security System via App Given that I am a customer with the mobile app installed When I open the app And select the 'Arm' or 'Disarm' option Then the security system should be armed or disarmed accordingly And I should receive a confirmation notification via the app Scenario: Viewing Live Camera Feeds via App Given that I am a customer with the mobile app installed When I open the app And select the 'Live Camera Feeds' option Then the app should display live video feeds from connected cameras And I should be able to view and control the camera feeds

input: As a customer, I want the ability to schedule temporary access codes for guests or service personnel.
output: Scrum User Story: Temporary Access Codes for Customers Description: As a customer, I want the ability to schedule temporary access codes for guests or service personnel. This will allow me to provide limited access to my property without compromising security. Criteria of acceptance: Customers should be able to create temporary access codes with specified start and end times. Temporary access codes should only be valid during the scheduled period. Customers should receive notifications when temporary access codes are used. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Creating Temporary Access Codes Given that I am a customer When I access the access code settings And I want to create a temporary access code for a guest or service personnel Then I should be able to specify the start and end times for the code Scenario: Using Temporary Access Codes Given that I am a customer with a created temporary access code When the scheduled time for the code arrives And someone enters the code to access my property Then I should receive a notification about the code usage Scenario: Deactivating Temporary Access Codes Given that I am a customer with a created temporary access code When the scheduled end time for the code passes And I access the access code settings Then I should be able to deactivate or delete the temporary access code

input: As a customer, I want to have a backup power source for my security system to ensure continuous operation during power outages.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Power for Security System Description: As a customer, I want to have a backup power source for my security system to ensure continuous operation during power outages. This will provide peace of mind knowing that my security system remains active even when the main power supply is interrupted. Criteria of acceptance: The security system should have a backup power source, such as a battery or generator. The backup power source should be capable of providing power for an extended period during an outage. Customers should receive notifications when the main power supply is interrupted and when the backup power source is in use. Gherkin Scenarios: Scenario: Detecting Power Outages Given that I am a customer When a power outage occurs And my security system detects the interruption in the main power supply Then I should receive a notification about the power outage Scenario: Activating Backup Power Given that I am a customer with a backup power source When the main power supply is interrupted And my security system activates the backup power source Then the security system should continue to function normally Scenario: Monitoring Backup Power Level Given that I am a customer with a backup power source When the backup power source is in use And the power outage continues And the backup power level becomes critical Then I should receive a notification about the low backup power level

input: As a customer, I want to be able to customize the sensitivity of motion sensors to reduce false alarms.
output: Scrum User Story: Customizable Motion Sensor Sensitivity Description: As a customer, I want to be able to customize the sensitivity of motion sensors to reduce false alarms. This will allow me to fine-tune the sensor settings based on my home environment and preferences. Criteria of acceptance: Customers should have the option to adjust the sensitivity of motion sensors through the control panel or mobile app. The adjustments should range from low to high sensitivity levels. input: As a customer, I want the ability to customize the names and labels for sensors in my security system for easier identification.

input: As a customer, I want to be able to control my security system using voice commands through virtual assistants like Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant.
output: Scrum User Story: Voice Control for Customers Description: As a customer, I want to be able to control my security system using voice commands through virtual assistants like Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant. Acceptance Criteria: Customers should be able to link their security system to virtual assistant devices and control system functions, such as arming and disarming, using voice commands. Scenario: Arming and Disarming with Voice Commands Given that I am a customer with a linked virtual assistant When I use voice commands to arm or disarm the security system Then the system should recognize the voice command And ask for user authentication, such as a PIN or biometric confirmation. Scenario: Verifying System Status with Voice Given that I am a customer with a linked virtual assistant When I use voice commands to check the status of my security system, such as asking if it's armed or if there are any alerts Then the virtual assistant should provide me with the current system status based on real-time information.

output: Scrum User Story: Geofencing for Arming and Disarming Description: As a homeowner, I want to set up geofencing for my security system, so that the system can automatically arm or disarm based on my smartphone's location. Acceptance Criteria: The security system should support the setup of geofencing rules. Homeowners should be able to define a geographic area (geofence) where the system should automatically arm or disarm. The system should use the homeowner's smartphone location to trigger arming and disarming. Scenario: Setting Up Geofencing Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system When I want to set up geofencing for automatic arming and disarming And I access the geofencing settings in the mobile app or control panel Then I should be able to define a geofence by specifying a location and radius. Scenario: Arming with Geofencing Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have set up a geofence for automatic arming When I leave the defined geofence area with my smartphone Then the system should automatically arm itself. Scenario: Disarming with Geofencing Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have set up a geofence for automatic disarming When I enter the defined geofence area with my smartphone Then the system should automatically disarm itself.

input: As a homeowner, I want to integrate my security system with a voice assistant, such as Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant, so that I can control and monitor my security system using voice commands.
output: Scrum User Story: Voice Assistant Integration Description: As a homeowner, I want to integrate my security system with a voice assistant, such as Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant, so that I can control and monitor my security system using voice commands. Acceptance Criteria: The security system should support integration with popular voice assistants, such as Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant. Homeowners should be able to link their security system with a voice assistant account. Voice commands should enable control of security functions and provide system status updates. Scenario: Linking the Security System with Voice Assistant Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system When I want to integrate the security system with my voice assistant account, such as Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant And I access the voice assistant integration settings Then I should be able to link the accounts and grant necessary permissions. Scenario: Voice-Controlled Security Functions Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have integrated my voice assistant When I issue voice commands to the voice assistant to control security functions, such as arming or disarming Then the voice assistant should relay the commands to the security system And the security system should respond accordingly. Scenario: Voice-Activated System Status Updates Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have integrated my voice assistant When I ask the voice assistant for a system status update, such as checking if the system is armed Then the voice assistant should query the security system for the status And provide a voice response with the relevant system information.

input: As a homeowner, I want to receive weather alerts and emergency notifications through my security system, so that I can stay informed about weather-related threats and take appropriate action.
output: Scrum User Story: Weather and Emergency Alerts Description: As a homeowner, I want to receive weather alerts and emergency notifications through my security system, so that I can stay informed about weather-related threats and take appropriate action. Acceptance Criteria: The security system should provide a feature for homeowners to enable weather alerts and emergency notifications. The system should receive weather alerts from a trusted weather service provider. Notifications should include severe weather warnings and emergency alerts. Scenario: Enabling Weather Alerts and Emergency Notifications Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system When I want to enable weather alerts and emergency notifications And I access the notification settings in the mobile app or control panel Then I should be able to enable the notifications for weather and emergency alerts. Scenario: Receiving Weather Alerts Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have enabled weather alerts and emergency notifications When a severe weather warning is issued by a trusted weather service provider in my area Then I should receive a notification on my smartphone specifying the nature of the weather alert. Scenario: Responding to Emergency Alerts Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have enabled emergency notifications When an emergency alert is issued in my area, such as an Amber Alert or civil emergency Then I should receive a notification with details about the emergency situation And the notification should include guidance on how to respond or take appropriate action.

input: As a homeowner, I want to receive alerts when my surveillance cameras detect specific objects or events, such as a person or a vehicle, so that I can quickly respond to potential security threats.
output: Scrum User Story: Object Detection Alerts Description: As a homeowner, I want to receive alerts when my surveillance cameras detect specific objects or events, such as a person or a vehicle, so that I can quickly respond to potential security threats. Acceptance Criteria: The surveillance camera system should support object detection capabilities. Homeowners should be able to configure object detection rules and alerts. The system should send real-time notifications when objects or events of interest are detected. Scenario: Configuring Object Detection Rules Given that I am a homeowner with Securitas Direct surveillance cameras When I want to set up object detection rules for my cameras And I access the object detection settings Then I should be able to specify the objects or events I want to be alerted about, such as persons or vehicles. Scenario: Receiving Object Detection Alerts Given that I am a homeowner with Securitas Direct surveillance cameras And I have configured object detection rules When an object or event of interest is detected by a camera Then I should receive a real-time notification specifying the type of object or event detected And the notification should include a link to view the camera footage. Scenario: Verifying Object Detection Alerts Given that I am a homeowner with Securitas Direct surveillance cameras And I have received an object detection alert When I view the camera footage related to the alert Then I should be able to verify the presence of the detected object or event And take appropriate action if necessary.

input: As a homeowner, I want to have a panic button feature on my security system, so that I can quickly alert authorities or emergency services in case of a security or medical emergency.
output: Scrum User Story: Panic Button Feature Description: As a homeowner, I want to have a panic button feature on my security system, so that I can quickly alert authorities or emergency services in case of a security or medical emergency. Acceptance Criteria: The security system should include a panic button feature accessible from the control panel or mobile app. Homeowners should be able to trigger the panic button to alert authorities or emergency services. Panic button activation should provide location information to responders. Scenario: Accessing the Panic Button Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system When I want to access the panic button feature for emergency situations And I access the panic button from the control panel or mobile app Then I should be able to activate the panic button with a single action. Scenario: Activating the Panic Button Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have accessed the panic button feature When I activate the panic button in case of a security or medical emergency Then the system should immediately send an alert to authorities or emergency services And the alert should include my location information. Scenario: Confirming Panic Button Activation Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system And I have activated the panic button in an emergency situation When the alert is received by authorities or emergency services Then I should receive confirmation that the panic button activation was successful And responders should arrive at the provided location for assistance.

input: As a homeowner, I want to receive notifications when my surveillance cameras detect package deliveries or visitors at my front door, so that I can monitor and manage deliveries and visitor interactions.
output: Scrum User Story: Package Delivery and Visitor Alerts Description: As a homeowner, I want to receive notifications when my surveillance cameras detect package deliveries or visitors at my front door, so that I can monitor and manage deliveries and visitor interactions. input: As a homeowner, I want to integrate my security system with my smart locks, so that I can remotely lock or unlock my doors and receive notifications of door activity.
output: Scrum User Story: Smart Lock Integration Description: As a homeowner, I want to integrate my security system with my smart locks, so that I can remotely lock or unlock my doors and receive notifications of door activity. Acceptance Criteria: The security system should support integration with compatible smart locks. Homeowners should be able to control and monitor smart locks through the mobile app or control panel. Locking or unlocking the doors should trigger notifications. Scenario: Integrating Smart Locks Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system and compatible smart locks When I want to integrate the smart locks with my security system And I access the smart lock integration settings Then I should be able to pair and configure the smart locks for use with the security system. Scenario: Remotely Locking and Unlocking Doors Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system and integrated smart locks When I want to remotely lock or unlock my doors And I open the mobile app or control panel Then I should be able to control the smart locks, including locking or unlocking the doors as needed. Scenario: Receiving Door Activity Notifications Given that I am a homeowner with a Securitas Direct security system and integrated smart locks When a door is locked or unlocked using the smart lock feature And the system is configured to do so Then I should receive a real-time notification specifying the door activity event And the notification should provide information about which door was affected.

input: As a homeowner, I want to set up and customize automated lighting control scenarios, so that I can enhance the security and convenience of my home.
output: Scrum User Story: Customizable Lighting Automation Description: As a homeowner, I want to set up and customize automated lighting control scenarios, so that I can enhance the security and convenience of my home. Acceptance Criteria: The security system should provide homeowners with the ability to create and manage customized lighting automation scenarios. Homeowners should be able to specify triggers, actions, and schedules for each automation scenario. The system should support a variety of lighting control options. Scenario: Creating Custom Lighting Automation Given that I am a homeowner with Securitas Direct security system When I want to create a custom lighting automation scenario And I access the lighting automation settings Then I should be able to specify the triggers, actions, and schedules for the automation scenario. Scenario: Configuring Trigger Events Given that I am a homeowner with Securitas Direct security system And I have created a lighting automation scenario When I want to configure trigger events that initiate the automation And I access the automation settings Then I should be able to specify triggers such as motion detection, door/window sensor activation, or specific times. Scenario: Defining Lighting Actions Given that I am a homeowner with Securitas Direct security system And I have created a lighting automation scenario When I want to define the lighting actions that occur when a trigger event occurs And I access the automation settings Then I should be able to configure actions like turning on or off lights, adjusting brightness, or changing colors based on the trigger event.

input: As a homeowner, I want to integrate my security system with my carbon monoxide (CO) detectors, so that I can receive alerts and notifications in case of a CO leak.
output: Scrum User Story: Carbon Monoxide (CO) Detector Integration Description: As a homeowner, I want to integrate my security system with my carbon monoxide (CO) detectors, so that I can receive alerts and notifications in case of a CO leak. input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a long-lasting battery, so that it remains operational for an extended period without frequent charging.
output: Scrum User Story: Long-Lasting Battery Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a long-lasting battery, so that it remains operational for an extended period without frequent charging. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should have a rechargeable battery. The battery should provide at least 24 hours of continuous operation on a single charge. The device should have a low battery indicator to alert me when it needs recharging. Scenario: Checking Battery Status Given that I have a PERS device with a rechargeable battery When I check the battery status And the battery is fully charged Then the device should indicate a full battery. Scenario: Battery Life During Emergency Given that I have a PERS device with a fully charged battery When I press the assistance button during an emergency And I need to use the device for an extended period Then the device should continue to function for at least 24 hours without needing a recharge. Scenario: Low Battery Notification Given that I have a PERS device with a low battery When the battery level drops below a certain threshold And I need to recharge the device Then the device should provide a low battery notification to alert me.

input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a waterproof design, so that I can wear it in the shower or bath without concerns about water damage.
output: Scrum User Story: Waterproof Design Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a waterproof design, so that I can wear it in the shower or bath without concerns about water damage. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should have an IPX7 or higher waterproof rating. It should be safe to wear while bathing or showering. The device should be able to withstand water immersion for at least 30 minutes without damage. Scenario: Wearing the PERS Device in the Shower Given that I have a PERS device with a waterproof design When I wear the device in the shower or bath Then the device should remain fully operational without any water damage or malfunction. Scenario: Immersion Test Given that I have a PERS device with a waterproof rating When I accidentally drop the device in water And it remains submerged for 30 minutes Then the device should still function properly after being retrieved from the water. Scenario: Cleaning the Device Given that I have a PERS device with a waterproof design When I clean the device under running water as per the instructions Then the device should not be damaged by the water, and it should remain functional.

input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have fall detection capabilities, so that it can automatically request assistance if I experience a fall and am unable to press the assistance button.
output: Scrum User Story: Fall Detection Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have fall detection capabilities, so that it can automatically request assistance if I experience a fall and am unable to press the assistance button. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should have built-in fall detection sensors. It should be able to detect falls and automatically initiate an emergency call if a fall is detected. Fall detection should be accurate and minimize false alarms. Scenario: Fall Detection Trigger Given that I have a PERS device with fall detection When I experience a fall or a similar sudden impact And I am unable to press the assistance button Then the device should automatically trigger an emergency call for assistance. Scenario: False Alarm Prevention Given that I have a PERS device with fall detection When I engage in activities that may involve sudden movements, such as exercise or bending down And I do not experience a fall Then the device should not trigger a false alarm or emergency call. Scenario: Confirmation Call Given that I have a PERS device with fall detection When the device triggers an automatic emergency call due to fall detection Then the response center should attempt to establish voice contact with me to confirm the emergency situation before dispatching help.

input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have two-way communication, so that I can speak directly with the response center in case of an emergency or need for assistance.
output: Scrum User Story: Two-Way Communication Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have two-way communication, so that I can speak directly with the response center in case of an emergency or need for assistance. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should have a built-in microphone and speaker for two-way communication. Scenario: Requesting Assistance with Voice Communication Given that I have a PERS device with two-way communication When I press the assistance button to request help And the device establishes a voice connection with the response center Then I should be able to communicate my emergency or assistance needs verbally. Scenario: Voice Connection Quality Given that I have a PERS device with two-way communication When I use the voice communication feature during an emergency And the device establishes a voice connection Then the voice connection should be clear and free from significant disruptions to ensure effective communication. input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have GPS tracking, so that the response center can quickly locate me in case of an emergency or if I am unable to provide my location.
output: Scrum User Story: GPS Tracking Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have GPS tracking, so that the response center can quickly locate me in case of an emergency or if I am unable to provide my location. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should be equipped with GPS technology for accurate location tracking. It should transmit my location data to the response center when I request assistance or in the event of a fall. The response center should be able to access my real-time location information. Scenario: Requesting Assistance with GPS Location Given that I have a PERS device with GPS tracking When I press the assistance button to request help And the device transmits my GPS location to the response center Then the response center should have access to my accurate location information. Scenario: Fall Detection and GPS Location Given that I have a PERS device with GPS tracking and fall detection When the device detects a fall and triggers an emergency call And it simultaneously transmits my GPS location to the response center Then the response center should have access to my accurate location, even if I am unable to provide it verbally. Scenario: Real-Time Location Tracking Given that I have a PERS device with GPS tracking When I am wearing the device on a daily basis And the response center needs to locate me during an emergency Then the response center should be able to access my real-time GPS location for quick assistance.

input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a backup communication method, such as cellular connectivity, so that I can request assistance even if my home phone line or Wi-Fi is not working.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Communication Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a backup communication method, such as cellular connectivity, so that I can request assistance even if my home phone line or Wi-Fi is not working. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should include a backup cellular connection that can be used in case the primary home phone line or Wi-Fi connection is unavailable. Scenario: Wi-Fi Network Unavailable Given that I have a PERS device with backup cellular connectivity When my Wi-Fi network is not working And I need to request assistance or communicate with the response center Then the device should use the backup cellular connection to ensure continued communication. Scenario: Testing Cellular Backup Given that I have a PERS device with backup cellular connectivity When I want to test the cellular backup functionality And I initiate a non-emergency call to the response center Then the device should successfully establish a connection using the cellular backup.

input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a customizable emergency contact list, so that I can specify who should be contacted in case of an emergency.

Scenario: Adding Emergency Contacts Given that I have a PERS device with customizable emergency contacts When I want to add a new contact to the list And I access the device's settings Then I should be able to enter the contact's name and phone number for emergency notifications. input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a backup power source, such as a rechargeable battery or backup power supply, so that it remains operational during power outages.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Power Source Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a backup power source, such as a rechargeable battery or backup power supply, so that it remains operational during power outages. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should have a backup power source, such as a rechargeable battery or backup power supply. The backup power source should provide at least 24 hours of continuous operation when the primary power source is unavailable. The device should alert me when it switches to backup power. Scenario: Primary Power Source Failure Given that I have a PERS device with a backup power source When the primary power source experiences an outage, such as a power cut And the device switches to the backup power source Then the device should remain operational and provide continued protection during the outage. Scenario: Backup Power Notification Given that I have a PERS device with a backup power source When the device switches to the backup power source due to a power outage And the backup power source is activated Then the device should notify me of the power source switch to ensure awareness. Scenario: Testing Backup Power Given that I have a PERS device with a backup power source When I want to test the backup power functionality And I disconnect the primary power source temporarily Then the device should switch to the backup power source and remain operational during the test.

input: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a backup system for power and communication, such as a backup battery and cellular connectivity, to ensure its reliability in emergencies.
output: Scrum User Story: Backup Power and Communication Description: As a PERS user, I want the device to have a backup system for power and communication, such as a backup battery and cellular connectivity, to ensure its reliability in emergencies. Acceptance Criteria: The PERS device should have a backup power source, such as a rechargeable battery, that provides at least 24 hours of continuous operation in case of a power outage. It should also have backup communication capabilities, such as cellular connectivity, to establish communication with the response center when the primary communication network is unavailable. Scenario: Power Outage and Backup Battery Given that I have a PERS device with backup power capabilities When a power outage occurs at my residence And I press the assistance button to request help Then the device should switch to the backup battery power source and remain operational during the outage. input: As a user, I want to receive real-time location updates for my tracked assets, so I can stay informed about their movements.
output: Scrum User Story: Real-Time Location Updates Description: As a user, I want to receive real-time location updates for my tracked assets, so I can stay informed about their movements. Acceptance Criteria: The mobile app should provide real-time location updates for all tracked assets. Users should be able to select individual assets to track on the map. The app should display the asset's location, speed, and direction in real-time. Scenario: Selecting Asset for Real-Time Tracking Given that I am a user with tracked assets When I open the app And select an asset for real-time tracking Then the app should display the asset's location on the map And update the location in real-time. Scenario: Viewing Asset Details When Tracking Given that I am tracking an asset in real-time When I tap on the tracked asset on the map Then the app should display additional details such as speed and direction of movement. Scenario: Pausing Real-Time Tracking Given that I am tracking an asset in real-time When I want to pause real-time tracking And I select the pause option Then the app should stop updating the asset's location until I resume tracking.

input: As a user, I want to create and manage geofences to define specific areas of interest for my tracked assets.
output: Scrum User Story: Geofence Creation and Management Description: As a user, I want to create and manage geofences to define specific areas of interest for my tracked assets. Acceptance Criteria: The mobile app should allow users to create, edit, and delete geofences on the map. Scenario: Deleting a Geofence Given that I have created geofences When I no longer need a specific geofence And I select the delete option for the geofence Then the app should delete the geofence and remove it from the list of managed geofences.

input: As a user, I want to receive geofence alerts when my tracked assets enter or exit predefined geographical areas.
output: Scrum User Story: Geofence Alerts Description: As a user, I want to receive geofence alerts when my tracked assets enter or exit predefined geographical areas. Acceptance Criteria: The mobile app should provide geofence alert settings for each tracked asset. Scenario: Configuring Geofence Alerts Given that I am a user with tracked assets When I access the geofence alert settings for an asset And I configure entry and exit alerts for a specific geofence Then the app should save the alert settings for that asset and geofence combination. Scenario: Receiving Entry Alerts Given that I have configured geofence entry alerts When a tracked asset enters a predefined geofence area And I have the app running in the background Then the app should send a real-time notification alerting me of the entry. Scenario: Receiving Exit Alerts Given that I have configured geofence exit alerts When a tracked asset exits a predefined geofence area And I have the app running in the background Then the app should send a real-time notification alerting me of the exit.

input: As a user, I want the ability to share real-time location information of my tracked assets with trusted contacts, so they can stay informed about their whereabouts.
output: Scrum User Story: Asset Location Sharing Description: As a user, I want the ability to share real-time location information of my tracked assets with trusted contacts, so they can stay informed about their whereabouts. output: Scrum User Story: Speed Limit Notifications Description: As a user, I want to receive notifications when my tracked assets exceed predefined speed limits, ensuring their safe usage. input: As a user, I want to customize the frequency of location updates for my tracked assets, allowing me to balance real-time tracking with conserving battery life.
output: Scrum User Story: Customizable Location Update Frequency Description: As a user, I want to customize the frequency of location updates for my tracked assets, allowing me to balance real-time tracking with conserving battery life. Scenario: Balancing Battery Life and Real-Time Tracking Given that I have customized location update frequencies for assets When I have selected update intervals to balance real-time tracking with battery life conservation And I confirm the settings Then the app should apply the selected update intervals for the assets, optimizing tracking and battery performance.

input: As a user, I want the option to receive location updates for my tracked assets even when the mobile app is running in the background, ensuring continuous monitoring.
output: Scrum User Story: Background Location Updates Description: As a user, I want the option to receive location updates for my tracked assets even when the mobile app is running in the background, ensuring continuous monitoring. Acceptance Criteria: The mobile app should provide the option for users to enable background location updates for tracked assets. When this option is enabled, the app should continue to receive and display location updates even when running in the background. Users should receive notifications for critical events in the background, such as speed limit violations or geofence alerts. Scenario: Enabling Background Location Updates Given that I am a user with tracked assets When I open the app And access the settings for background location updates And I enable the option for background updates Then the app should continue to receive location updates for tracked assets even when running in the background. Scenario: Receiving Background Notifications Given that I have enabled background location updates for assets When a critical event, such as a speed limit violation or geofence alert, occurs while the app is in the background And I have enabled background notifications Then the app should send a real-time notification for the event, ensuring I am informed. Scenario: Disabling Background Location Updates Given that I have enabled background location updates for assets When I want to conserve battery life or reduce data usage And I disable the option for background updates in the app settings Then the app should stop receiving location updates for tracked assets in the background.

input: As a user, I want to be able to track my assets even in areas with poor or no network connectivity, ensuring continuous monitoring.
output: Scrum User Story: Offline Tracking Description: As a user, I want to be able to track my assets even in areas with poor or no network connectivity, ensuring continuous monitoring. Acceptance Criteria: The mobile app should provide offline tracking capabilities for assets. When assets enter areas with poor or no network connectivity, the app should continue to record their locations and store the data locally. Once network connectivity is restored, the app should upload the stored location data. Scenario: Tracking Assets in Offline Areas Given that I am a user with tracked assets When my assets enter an area with poor or no network connectivity And the app loses connection Then the app should continue to track and record the asset's location locally. Scenario: Uploading Offline Location Data Given that I am a user with assets that were tracked offline When network connectivity is restored And I open the app again Then the app should upload the stored location data to the server, ensuring I have access to the historical tracking information. Scenario: Managing Offline Tracking History Given that I have accessed offline tracking history for an asset When I want to manage the offline tracking data, such as deleting or exporting it And I access the offline tracking history section Then the app should allow me to manage the stored data, including deletion and export options.

input: As a user, I want the ability to track assets not only in real-time but also with historical playback, enabling me to review past journeys.
output: Scrum User Story: Historical Playback for Assets Description: As a user, I want the ability to track assets not only in real-time but also with historical playback, enabling me to review past journeys. output: Scrum User Story: Historical Movement Reports Description: As a user, I want to be able to generate and export reports summarizing the historical movements and routes of my tracked assets, allowing for analysis and record-keeping. Acceptance Criteria: The mobile app should provide features for users to generate and export historical movement reports for tracked assets. Scenario: Managing Shared Tracking Given that I have shared tracking information with others When I want to manage or revoke the sharing access And I access the tracking sharing management section in the app Then the app should allow me to control and adjust the shared tracking access, including revoking access if needed.

input: As a homeowner, I want to be able to view the status of my security system at any time, so that I can ensure my home is protected.

Acceptance Criteria: The security system should provide notifications for power interruptions. Users should receive notifications when the power supply to the system is interrupted. input: As a customer, I want to receive email receipts for my payments, providing a record of my transactions and confirming the successful completion of payments.
output: Scrum User Story: Email Receipts for Payments Description: As a customer, I want to receive email receipts for my payments, providing a record of my transactions and confirming the successful completion of payments. input: As a customer, I want to have the option to set up automatic recurring payments, simplifying the payment process and ensuring on-time payments for my security services.
output: Scrum User Story: Recurring Payments Description: As a customer, I want to have the option to set up automatic recurring payments, simplifying the payment process and ensuring on-time payments for my security services. Acceptance Criteria: Customers should be able to set up recurring payments for their security services. input: As a customer, I want to receive alerts and notifications for any changes to my billing information, enhancing security and ensuring transparency.
output: Scrum User Story: Billing Information Alerts Description: As a customer, I want to receive alerts and notifications for any changes to my billing information, enhancing security and ensuring transparency. Acceptance Criteria: Customers should receive alerts for any updates or changes to their billing information. input: As a customer, I want the ability to contact customer support for billing-related inquiries and assistance with payment issues.
